## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

library(tidyverse)
datensatz <- readRDS("robo_pflege.rds")
datensatz <- names()
datensatz %>% select(robo_toilett) %>% psych::describe()
datensatz %>% select(robo_toilett) %>% ggplot() + aes(x = robo_toilett) + geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill="red")

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
datensatz <- readRDS("robo_pflege.rds")
datensatz <- names()
datensatz %>% select(robo_toilett) %>% psych::describe()
datensatz %>% select(robo_toilett) %>% ggplot() + aes(x = robo_toilett) + geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill="red")
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
datensatz <- readRDS("robo_pflege.rds")
datensatz <- names()
datensatz %>% select(human_toilett) %>% psych::describe()
datensatz %>% select(human_toilett) %>% ggplot() + aes(x = human_toilett) + geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill="green")
```
```{r}
datensatz <- readRDS("robo_pflege.rds")
datensatz_kurz <- datensatz[,c("age", "gender", "kut", "human_toilett", "robo_toilett")]
datensatz_kurz %>% psych::describe() %>% select(vars, mean, sd, median, min, max)
```
